title: argentina exploit no deal brexit falklands britain
story: The country’s foreign minister Jorge Faurie said his country would use the situation to “enhance” its own diplomatic push to take over the islands.Talking to the , Mr Faurie said once the UK leaves the European Union, all EU treaties will no longer apply and member states wont be obliged to support the UK’s claim over the South Atlantic territory.He said: “Our planning for Las Malvinasis to have a negotiation that will enable stronger relations between the people on the islands and the people on the continent.“And we hope that the non Brexitsolution will enhance the possibility of that dialogue to be truly one with results.”Mr Faurie suggested Argentina could take advantage of looser diplomatic ties between the UK and EU as part of its ongoing bid to take control of the Falklands.Mr Faurie said: “If you think member states [of the EU] would not sustain the Malvinas claim in favour of the UK, we are there ... to talk, to negotiate, to see what would be the best solution for the people in the islands to be much more in touch with Argentina.”It comes amid growing uncertainty over the legal status of the UKs overseas territories.Under the EU’s  Lisbon Treaty, the Falkland Islands are a British overseas territory where EU rules apply.The EU’s Duty of Sincere Cooperation includes a a mutual legal obligation for the EU member states to help each other over any claims over sovereignty.Mr Faurie, on a visit to the UK, reiterated his position that the Falklands, which Britain went to war over in , should be integrated into mainland Argentina.UK Prime Minister Theresa May is due to meet Argentinian president Mauricio Macri at the G in Buenos Aires on November .This would be the first visit by a British prime minister to Argentina since Tony Blair in .

title: vince cable brexit strictly come dancing
story: The Lib Dem leader - who appeared on the show in  - was last night accused of “Project Fear with tassels” by Leave-voting MPs.Sir Vince says post-Brexit immigration rules could force out the shows popular dancers, he told the .And he was speaking with experience, having competed in the  Christmas special.But critics, including Jacob Rees-Mogg described his comments as silly.After a meeting at the European Commission in Brussels on Thursday, Mr Cable begged EU negotiator Michel Barnier to give Britain time for a second referendum.He said: As British society falls apart it could pose a risk to Strictly.“If we have a cack-handed immigration policy like what we have for non-EU citizens all kinds of perverse decisions could be made.”Out of Strictlys current batch of glam dancers, five are British, four are from the EU and nine come from where.Sir Vince claimed the UK would have to ringfence the citizenship arrangements to protect them.”Jacob Rees-Mogg replied: The idea that Brexit will have any effect on Strictly is simply silly.“I wouldn’t hold myself up as an expert on Strictly. I watched it when Ed Balls was on it but never since.He added: “But it is hard to see that immigration rules are key to the success of Strictly or otherwise.“There are already effective and efficient immigration provisions for artists such as opera singers and ballet dancers.”Andrew Bridgen, the MP for North West Leicestershire, said, “Since the majority of Strictly professional dancers are non-EU citizens, I am sure we will have no problem with dealing with EU citizens in the same way after Brexit.”“This is more desperate Project Fear with tassels on it from Vince Cable,” Mr Bridgen said, “it is surely time that he waltzes off into retirement.”Still an avid dancer, Vince Cable recently reached the final of the over-’s British ballroom competition.He was in Brussels with Ian Blackford, the leader of SNP MPs  and Liz Saville Roberts, the Westminster leader of Plaid Cymru.

title: meghan markle prince harry plane abort landing sydney airport
story: The Qantas jet pulled up moments before touching down at Sydney Airport after spotting another aircraft on the runway.The royal couples plane can be seen swooping down towards the ground with its wheels lowered as it prepares to land.But it suddenly lts back up with just seconds to spare after co-pilot Ann Cole realised the runway wasnt clear.The plane - which got as low as ft before aborting the landing - then circled back round to attempt it again, this time touching down safely.There were around  people on board the special charter flight from Tonga.All Harry and Meghan’s staff were on the plane, including a number of politan police protection officers and around  journalists.Captain Nigel Rosser spoke to passengers when the plane climbed back into the air after the aborted landing.He said: “It was a missed approach.“There was an aircraft on the runway that was a little bit slow to roll and unfortunately hadn’t cleared the runway.“We were too close and the decision was made to abort the landing.“So for the second time today you’ll get great views of the harbour.“We’ll get you there safely as soon as possible.”Journalists on the flight tweeted to reveal the drama.ABC News reporter James Longman tweeted: “Missed approach for the Royal Charter back into Sydney.“Another plane on the runway getting in the way. So we’re coming around again.”Hello! royal editor Emily Nash added: “The pilot on Harry and Meghan’splane just had to abort the landing in Sydney seconds from wheels down because of another plane on the runway.“Superb safe second attempt by @qantas Captain Nigel Rosser.”The slight delay means the royal couple may have to rush to attend the Australian Geographic Society Awards to be held at Sydney’s Shangri-La Hotel tonight.The pair are ing to Australia for only a quick visit.After tonight’s event their only official engagement will be tomorrow’s Invictus Games closing ceremony.But the royal tour will continue with Prince Harry and Meghan flying to New Zealand on Sunday.Kensington Palace declined to comment on the aborted landing.Sun Online has contacted Qantas for comment.Meghan and Harry earlier left from Tonga after finishing their tour of the paradise Pacic isle.The mum-to-be cried tears of laughter after school kids sang a comedy song about mosquitoes before they left.She was pictured in hysterics as The Tupou College Boys choir used flying actions and buzzing noises to serenade her and husband Harry.

title: universal credit help paid fortnightly
story: But the Governments new flagship benefits system, which is being rolled out across the country, does have provisions where you can apply to get money more regularly instead.There are three types of help available for vulnerable Brits called alternative payment arrangements, which arent always known about.Claimants can arrange for their landlord to get their benefits paid directly, they can split their payments between a couple, or apply for more regular payments.These are offered for those in special circumstances, or for Brits who are considered more at risk and need extra help.Heres how you can get the additional supportyoure struggling on Universal Credit.The DWP can decide to pay you more frequentlyit thinks that you are in high need of it.This could include Brits with:You can speak to your work coachyou think you could be eligible, and identy the factors which apply. Being paid weekly only happens in very exceptional circumstances.The DWP make the final decision, and you cant appeal it. But you can ask for it at any point, and it will be reviewed regularly.You need to be able to show that you cannot manage the single monthly payments.Housing benefit is part of Universal Credit, and most claimants are responsible for paying their landlord themselves.But you can also apply to get a managed payment directly to the landlord, so it doesnt go into your bank account at all.Any part of your rent it doesnt cover will have to be paid by yourself, separately.As of May  around seven per cent of people on Universal Credit had their support paid directly to the landlord.Either you, your representative or your landlord can make this request over the phone, by email or post.In instances of domestic abuse, or when one partner mismanages the Universal Credit payment, you can apply for a split benefit.When a couple are together in the same household with one claim, in very exceptional circumstances it can be ided into two.They are meant to prevent hardship to the claimant and the family.The larger percentage can be allocated to the person with primary caring responsibilities.The DWP says to speak to your work coach about alternative payment arrangements and seeyoure illegible.Today it was revealed that almost half of Brits on Universal Credit are struggling with their finances after nine months.The new system was also reported to be riddled with errors - requiring huge amounts of data and not alerting claimants when theres messages.And mums on the flagship benefits programme told MPs this week that the system penalised single parents.

title: how sir philip green has repeatedly shown flashes of his notorious temper in public
story: The retail boss, who owns Topshop, Miss Selfridge and Dorothy Perkins, was yesterday unmaksed as the man behind a gagging order over harassment and bullying claims.While he categorically denies the allegations, recent public outbursts have been caught on camera showing him launch into bizarre rants and even a heated scuffle.In  the mogul was tracked to his super-yacht in Ithaca, Greece, as he soaked up the sun amid the controversial collapse of BHS.After being approached by Sky News reporter David Bowden, he told him to go away and threatened to call the police.The mogul then launched himself at the camera, gesticulating wildly and warning: Thats going in the f***ing sea.Bowden had asked him: People will want to know why youre on holiday when they think you should be sorting out the pension deficit.Sky News said that, off-camera, the pair eventually calmed down and shook hands - but just weeks earlier Sir Philip was involved in a heated exchange with MPs.He left members of the Select Committee stunned when he turned to co-chair Frank Field and asked him to get “your lady” — Labour’s Karen Buck — to stop giving him a hard time.Sir Philip also stopped at one point to demand Tory backbencher Richard Fuller stop staring at him.The under-fire businessman said: “Sir, do you mind not looking at me like that all the time, it’s really disturbing. Sorry, do you just want to stare at me, it’s making me uncomfortable that’s all.”Mr Fuller replied: “I wasn’t quite just staring at you but I don’t want to make you uncomfortable. I don’t wish to make you uncomfortable.He then told Horsham MP Jeremy Quin to put your glasses back on, you look better with your glasses on.When another MP on the committee asked himhe would prevent somebody buying BHS as it could hurt his ego, he blasted: Oh come on please, thats an insult.You know thats really rude. I find that really rude [...] Im glad the meeting is ending, I think thats disgusting.One year later, in May , Sir Philip was involved in another alleged altercation - this time with a photographer.While covering the Cannes film festival, the mogul was spotted out jogging by a photographer who began taking photos.Sir Philip is claimed to have approached the man and ripped his earphones out, before informing him that he was calling the police while making attempts to grab his camera.The photographer, speaking to The Sun Online, claimed: For my own safety I pulled my iPhone out to film the incident for protection.He then said he was going to call the police while he then proceeded to jab his fingers in my face while he tried to grab the iPhone and then my professional camera.Once he had his hands on my camera he then used the weight of it to elbow me in the mouth.He cut my lip open and somehow ended up ripping one of my fingernail off. He got on his satellite phone and called for a tender to come and meet him.Seeing that I had blood pouring from my mouth me he ran quickly and escaped onto a tender to his boat.The photographer added: Had he have asked in a civil manner I would have just deleted the pictures.He didn’t even ask he just attacked me from behind in a thuggish and brutish way. Not the behaviour you would expect from a man honoured with a knighthood.There have been calls for retail tycoon Sir Philip Green to be stripped of his knighthood after he was named in Parliament as the businessman at the centre of #MeToo allegations of sexual harassment and racial abuse.The chairman of the House of Commons Work and Pensions Committee Frank Field, who led condemnation of Sir Philip over his treatment of BHS pensioners, said: The charge sheet against the knighthood is growing.Parliament and the country have made their views clear on this matter. Ultimately its a decision for the Honours Forfeiture Committee.Liberal Democrat leader Sir Vince Cable said Sir Philip narrowly and luckily escaped losing his knighthood over the pensions scandal.And he added: If these allegations are correct, he should certainly be stripped of his knighthood.Mr Field said he would push for the creation of a new procedure allowing MPs to raise abuse cases in Parliament.I am seeking to raise urgently with the Government the importance of having a mechanism in Parliament through which the voices of victims of abuse can be heard, said the Birkenhead MP.This would develop the role of the House of Commons in a way which stands up for people who have little money, against those who have much.Lord Hain said he had received overwhelming support - particularly from women after making his shock statement to the House of Lords.The recent allegations against Sir Philip do not mark the first time workers have spoken out about his alleged conduct.An anonymous employee in  wrote for the : Hatred is a terrible thing, but I have no idea what other response there could possibly be to a man such as Philip Green.The man is like a cancer: seemingly determined to grow and spread his little empire with no concern whatsoever for the effect that it may have on others.Sir Philip was unmasked yesterday by former cabinet minister Lord Hain, who used the protection of parliamentary privilege to identy the Arcadia chairman as the inidual behind a legal injunction preventing The Dailyfrom publishing confidential information from five employees.The paper reported that the tycoon is a the centre of #MeToo allegations including sexual harassment and racial abuse.He he said he categorically and wholly denied being guilty of any unlawful sexual or racist behaviour, in a statement issued hours after the Labour peers dramatic intervention in the House of Lords.

title: people wont be putting clocks back
story: Many don’t even realise they will wake up on Sunday morning after getting an extra hour of sleep.That is because more than half of UK adults,  per cent, no longer use analogue timepieces or technology.Brits will be waking up on Sunday morning to a home full of digital devices and Internet-connected phones, computers, TVs and appliances that will automatically reset the time themselves.The research was carried out by OSS Technology and it gives an insight into how physically winding the clocks back and fiddling with our watches will soon be a thing of the past.For the  per cent of Brits who say they still own analogue devices, at least  per cent of them have at least one device at home that is an hour out.And for a third of those polled, ignorance is bliss because they don’t even know that British Summer Timeis going to end.OSS Technology surveyed , adults across the UK to find out how they are preparing for the time change this Sunday.This year, Sunday, March , marked the start of BST and clocks went forward by one hour.The change ensures that there is more daylight in the evenings and less in the mornings.Greenwich Mean Timewill resume from the last Sunday in October– when the clocks go back one hour again.To avoid confusion, many use the phrase spring forward in spring, fall back in fall to remember when the clocks change.Clocks around Britain will go back at am on October , this is when BST goes and weto the classic GMT.

title: used condom co op fridge
story: Kenny Moore and friend Michael Bradshaw were disgusted when they made the discovery while on their lunch break in Holton-le-Clay, Lincs.And the pair claim workers had rled through the fridge and discovered another contraceptive.Kenny, , said: I went into the shop to get a meal deal out of the fridge.I got my sandwich, my pork pie, went to get my drink. title: picky roommate ad landlord no vegans
story: The picky proprietor, listed as Alex, has been accused of discrimination after he banned vegans from applying to rent his flat and told grubby flatmates to forget it.His SpareRoom advert that went live on Monday, warning viewers in block capitalsyoure vegan, dont bother before continuing to list other requirements.His duplex apartment, located in Manchesters Northern Quarter, boasts a spacious living room, bathroom and two bedrooms for £ per month.The live-in landlord, , even did his best to scare off dirty flatmates by writingyoure untidy in general - forget it.Alex brags that he is a pretty nice guy, laidback and not your typical landlord that everyone hates - though goes on to warn prospective tenants not to take the p**s.He also claims he cant be arsed with a   hour party animal either, sorry.Now the Vegan Society are urging the landlord to reconsider his decision and reminded Alex that vegans have excellent cooking skills.Alexs original advert reads: Hi, Im Alex and Ill be living with you as a live in landlord.I’m  years old. I’d like to think I’m a pretty nice guy - definitely not your typical landlord that everyone hates, I’m pretty laidback with everything, but don’t take the p***.***IF YOURE VEGAN, DONT BOTHER***My room is right above yours, on the second floor. On your level, there’s a kitchen, a bathroom and the front door. My bedroom is next to the living room upstairs.There is no wardrobe in your room, only a set of drawers, a small table and a bed which is enough for most people.There won’t be a TV in the living room until at least December, as I’m only just coming back from being abroad for  months. I’ll buy one as soon as I can.I can tell you right now thatyou aren’t keen on doing your own dishes oryou’re untidy in general - forget it.I cant be arsed with a   hour party animal either, sorry.After being made aware of the advert, the Vegan Society pointed out that had Alex been trying to rent out the whole house, such discrimination would not be appropriate.However he enjoys a loophole as a live-in landlord and is able to ensure only meat eaters are welcome.A spokesperson for The Vegan Society said: “While we can appreciate that the landlord was aiming for the advert to be humorous, we don’t quite understand why he would be opposed to living with a vegan.“It’s worth noting thathe was letting out a whole house, discrimination would not be appropriate but there is an exemption in certain situations such asyou’re a live-in landlord.“It is a well-known fact that many vegans are good cooks who pay attention to what goes into their meals.Vegans are often happy to cook for their housemates too, which we think might make Alex reconsider his decision to ban them from his home.”SpareRoom, the website where Alex posted his advert, have called his views contradictory and claim they prefer users to be a bit more positive in how they word things.A spokesperson for SpareRoom said: When people are advertising for someone to live with it’s common for them to have preferences in terms of their new flatmate.Saying ‘I’m pretty laid back with everything’, followed by ***IF YOU’RE VEGAN DON’T BOTHER*** feels like a bit of a contradiction.Ultimately, we’d always prefer itour users take people on the basis of who they are, rather than which ‘boxes’ they tick.When Alex was approached for comment, he said: Are you interested in the room or not

title: woman belly button removed sent boyfriend connection mum
story: After her body was mutilated, she bizarrely sent the belly button to her then boyfriend as a “present”.Paulina Casillas Landeros, , from Guadalajara in Jalisco, Mexico, fell out with her family as they disapproved of her way of le.They were unimpressed with her tattoos and extreme body modications such as a back corset – where piercings are created on either side of the spine, laced with ribbons and pulled tight – along with a split tongue.Annoyed they didn’t approve of her lestyle, she decided to remove her belly button out of spite, as it is what makes us human.She then gave it as a weird gt to her then boyfriend in .Since having her belly button removed three years ago, though, Landeros has made up with her family and ultimately regrets her decision, describing it as reckless and impulsive.The HR intern and tourism student explained: I have always had problems with my family, I was not very close to them at the time.Body modications fascinated me, there is something very transcending about them.Describing herself as very angry at the time, she decided to cut all unions from everything and everyone.I wanted to dehumanise myself in a symbolic way, I wanted to do something controversial.She had an operation to remove her belly button, but claims the professional gave me very bad advice on how to take care of the trauma so it got infected.I was suffering, I spent days in bed asI were quarantined. I couldn’t stretch, push, stand up or laugh.It gradually healed itself but not  per cent – it will never close entirely.Even though it was such a painful procedure, Landeros knew exactly what she wanted to do with her removed belly button.The young woman decided to turn it into a – some might say nauseating – token of love for her then boyfriend, Daniel Ramirez.She said: I was very much in love with my then boyfriend he supported me through many dficult times, and he is one of the most influential people in my le.It was something I did in the spur of the moment. We were young and stupid but that’s the way I felt.I put it in a small bag along with a note saying ‘I love you’. It was very emotional.He has kept it and he will keep it forever because he knows the meaning behind it.We are good friends now but we will always love each other.Her relationship with her family has improved since then and Landeros now realises how irreversible the decision to remove her belly button was.She also said: I do regret it when I put myself in my mum’s position, it must have been devastating for her, she was so sad.I can’t imagine how it must feel, your own child wanting to break all their connection to you.If I could go back in time, I wouldn’t do it again, it was impulsive, reckless and I hurt a lot of people.Even though I did it for the wrong reasons, it has now taught me I should think things through before acting and [the scar] is a nice reminder that characterises me.

title: hyperinflation causes affect venezuela
story: Here#s what you need to know about hyperinflation, what causes it and how it#s affected the South American country.Hyperinflation is the term used to describe when the costs of goods and services rise at a rate of more than  per cent a month.Due to the rate of hyperinflation, basic items such as a loaf of bread or milk could cost one price in the morning but be at a higher price within a matter of days.It rapidly erodes the real value of the currency.Hyperinflation occurs when there is a continuing rapid increase in the amount of money that is not supported by a corresponding growth in the output of goods and services.In simple terms, this means that when a country#s government starts printing money to pay for its spending but ends up with a surplus, it creates a vicious circle.Due to the rapid growth of new money, prices skyrocket and to counteract this, growing amounts of new money is needed to fund government deficits.This process then results in both monetary and price inflation at a rapid pace, causing the local population to spend money which further accelerates prices.This means that the increase in price level is greater than that of the money supply.Venezuela is in the grip of a hyperinflation economic catastrophe after  years of successive socialist governments have failed to control the cost of basic goods, which are now doubling in price on average every  days.Over the last five years, prices have risen  per cent in ,  per cent in ,  per cent in ,  percent in  and over , per cent in .The troubled nation now stands on the brink of collapse with spiralling inflation, which could hit one million per cent by the end of the year, as the economic crisis deepensIn April, , The Sun Online reported how many people can#t afford basic items like food and medicine, with child malnutrition at record levels in the country.Due to huge state subsidies, a full tank of petrol is around p —  times less than a bottle of water — but production is now so inefficient that the country is importing oil.A worker on the £-a-month minimum wage must now work for two weeks to afford a bag of rice.Inflation has affected Venezuelans so much that in , it was reported that some people became video game gold farmers to sell in-game currency or characters for real currency.In many cases, these gamers made more money than salaried workers in Venezuela even though they were earning just a few dollars per day.

title: ham pineapples pizza dont contain pork manchester
story: Instead of ham, the stores used thinly sliced processed turkey, according to tests run by food analysts.The shocking findings were revealed by ITV Tonight during a probe into the drastic drop in food sample tests being carried out by cash-strapped local authorities.Some  local authorities in Greater Manchester failed to carry out any food sampling tests of restaurants or takeaways  in the last year, a Freedom of Information request found.The news comes less than five years after the horsemeat scandal, which saw the meat sold as beef in ready meals in major UK supermarkets.At the time The Food Standards Agency was giving councils £.million for testing.But in the - financial year councils werent given a single penny.So this month researchers visited  random takeaways to test their ham and pineapple pizzas.Of the ten outlets they tested, just one sold them a pizza containing pork, according to public analyst Dr Duncan Campbell.Manchester City Council told the programme:It is never acceptable for food to be mislabelled and we will take action in cases where this is detected.Where meat has not been described accurately and businesses have not heeded advice, we have taken forward successful prosecution cases.As a result of this investigation, we will be contacting the businesses concerned.Simon Blackburn, a spokesman for the Local Government Agency, added: The number of trading standards officers that we employ across the UK is around half of what it was in , so half the amount of people unfortunately, they can’t do all the work that they used to be able to do.

title: man demand poppy removed outside home

I wasnt born then. If you put it up then it will be gone by the morning.He and a fellow councillor decided the remove the poppy but have been left shocked by the mans reaction.And the pensioner has now been slammed by Mick Golder, chairman of the Swadlincote district branch of the Royal British Legion, who said the poppies are a symbol of the soldiers sacrice.He said: The poppies are there because of the sacrice of all the soldiers who unfortunately died.Our motto this year is thank you to everyone who made the sacrice, and for someone to have that attitude, to me personally, is disgusting but then again we live in a free country.It shouldnt matteryou werent born during the war. title: man hiding 10 pound notes around uk
story: Matt Callanan has spent £, of his own money on a project he hopes will inspire people to do good deeds.So far film-maker Matt has left hundreds of envelopes scattered across Cardf and Dublin, and is planing to target cities in England and Scotland in the future.His project Tenner For Good involves putting a £ or € note in an envelope with two important rules.Number one: Dont spend the money on yourself. Number Two: Do some good with it.Matt stashes the cash in creative spots across the cities, including in bicycle wheels and on roadworks signs.He tries to place them in spots close to charity shops as a nudge to people who pick them up.In one instance he hid an envelope outside a childrens hospital under a bench.Matt told the Huffington Post: “[A man who works in the hospital] saw the envelope, went back in to the workplace, told them the story and they all started chipping in tenners.“He got to £ and he thought: what can we do for the kids They turned it into  Easter eggs and he went back dressed as a bunny and delivered all the eggs to the kids in the hospital.”He added: “I love that domino effect that you can create.“I think my favourite one that’s come out of it, there was this guy in Bristol and he didn’t find any of the tenners but he heard about it and wanted to do his own.“He brought this homeless guy into his house, listened to his story, gave him a cup of tea and on the way out gave him a couple of tenners, wished him well, and then the guy got back in touch with him a few weeks after that and said that he’d now got his benefits sorted, a job sorted and a house sorted.“And it was all because this guy Ben had given him his time and made him feel valued. That was just a lovely outcome.”Matt also teamed up with a local troop of Brownies to deliver thank you cards to doctors and nurses at a local hospital.He said: “And apparently all of these doctors and nurses ended up bursting into tears because it was just such a kind thing for these young girls to do for them.”

story: Edyta Ratecka, , claimed she was a single mum but was caught out by family snaps she posted on Facebook showing her enjoying holidays with her boyfriend.Polish-born Ratecka had claimed she was a single mum after giving birth to twins in  to swindle £, over a three year period.She was told by a judge she knew what she was doing because she worked in the benefits department of Cardf Council.Ratecka was today handed a -week suspended sentence after pleading guilty to fraudulent activity, making a  representation to obtain benefits, and of dishonesty failing to noty a change in circumstances.Cardf Crown Court heard how the mum began claiming benefits in  while living with Daniel Thomas but a probe was launched when the social media pictures surfaced.She claimed her boyfriend had moved in to help her after the birth of their sons - now aged five - but described their relationship as not good.Ratecka said she knew it was wrong to continue claiming benefits but insisted she had no option as Mr Thomas was not providing for her.Her lawyer, John Lewis, said she was now relying on her -year-old daughter to keep a roof over her head.Sentencing, Judge Tracey Lloyd-Clarke said: “You were working for a benefit section of Cardf council so you were aware of what you were doing.As well as a suspended prison sentence, she was ordered to carry out  hours unpaid work, complete a six-day rehabilitation activity requirement, and to pay £.

story: Siân-Louise Nightingale, , shared the bizarre video showing how the volume button on her TV remote could switch the heater on and off.The Aldi Flame Effect Heater comes with its own remote control so customers can switch it on and off and control the temperature.However, the medical receptionist quickly learned that her Sky remote was more versatile than she thought after paying £. for the flame-effect heater.She wrote on Aldi’s Facebook page: “Lovely new wall mounted electric fire...“Works on the same remote frequency as our Sky box.“Everytime we increase or decrease the TV volume, the fire tunes on off.”The video shows Siân-Louise, from Nottingham, in her living room pointing the remote towards her wall-mounted fire place.She then presses the volume decrease button on her television remote and the fire appears to turn on.When Siân-Louise presses the same button again the fire then turns off.Then she presses the button faster and it shows the fire turning on and off again.Other customers appear to have experienced this bizarre phenomenon as well.In the reviews section on Aldi’s website, user Jackie said her TV remote can turn the fire on and off.They said: “Good price purchase with real flame effect complete with its own remote control, but the TV remoteinterrupts the fire and switches it off.”Another user, Dean added: “Great fire, one problem other remotes ie Sky turn fire on so every time I use Sky remote fire switches on and heat goes up.”Siân-Louise said she quite liked the quirky behaviour of the fire and that she doesn’t think she will get a refund.She said: “A few people have reported the same and [Aldi] offered for me toit“But I quite like the fire. title: zante earthquake west coast greece 6 8 magnitude
story: The massive tremor struck in the dead of night on the country’s west coast, with the holiday isle of Zante – also called Zakynthos – worst affected.Brit tourists were among those caught up in the tremor, which was also felt in Greeces capital, Athens, and as far away as Italy and even Africa.One holidaymaker from Yorkshire told Sun Online how her terried family were left huddling outside their hotel as the building shook.Tracey Archer tweeted to travel agent Thomas Cook: Please do something!! We are stuck in Zante after an earthquake and everyone is outside the hotel in blankets.There’s babies and young children. Please do something, we’re scared and cold.Tracey, , told The Sun Online: Were terried. We’ve just had another bad aftershock and they keep coming.We were stood outside the hotel for about three hours in the freezing cold, scared.There were young children crying and screaming. We felt a quake about .am and later a larger one half an hour later.Were you affected by the earthquake  Email tips@the-sun or call   Tracey - who is staying at the Smartline Margarita Hotel with her partner Luke,  - said the quake knocked sinks off walls, pulled air con units down and shted furniture.She added: The bed was shaking violently for minutes.My partner and I screamed and grabbed each other and he put a pillow over us to protect us as we thought the ceiling would cave.Laura Sallabanks, , from Coningsby, Lincs, said her nine-year-old daughter was left “shaken” after rushing out of their accommodation in the Alykes area.She told Sun Online: “We woke up to a smaller quake, half hour before the big one which set things rattling in our rooms.“The big quake lasted a couple of minutes and felt like the whole building was swaying around us.“There was a loud rumble. I ran through to grab my daughter who is nine and we all rushed to get outside where we sat with the locals for a couple of hours.”The mum described “items thrown from shelves” and the quake leaving “cracked floor tiles and slabs”, admitting: “My poor heart is still pounding!”She added: “We can still feel aftershocks now after eight hours, which feel like dull rumbles.”Other Brits took to social media to tell of their experiences.One wrote: “Standing outside the hotel no clue what to do   Cracks in the building no @ThomasCookUK rep or advice.”Another posted: “Actual earthquake in #zante #zakynthos #kalamaki never experienced anything like that in my le!“Room shook for  seconds, followed by a longer period of vigorous shaking and with items falling off the bedside and around the room.“Electricity is off and everyone evacuated.”" data-credit"" data-sizes"auto" data-img"https:www.thesun wp-content uploads   quake.png stripallw" "" width""  " data-credit"" data-sizes"auto" data-img"https:www.thesun wp-content uploads   quake.png stripallw" "" width""  " data-credit"" data-sizes"auto" data-img"https:www.thesun wp-content uploads   quake.png stripallw" "" width"" A third tweeted: “Go to #Greece they said ... have a Nice relaxing holiday they said.“#Zante is lovely this time of year they said...then a cheeky  #earthquake on a full moon.“Rather unsettling. But buildings and the people here seem to be made of strong stuff so... So far, so good.”And another said: Me and my partner are staying in Zante, it woke my partner up, and weve had three aftershocks much smaller, the larger quake has moved several items around the room.Tremors were felt as far away as Italy and AlbaniaDramatic images show how the quake tore tarmac in half near the island’s harbour.Power was lost in the capital and main town, also called Zakynthos.The fire service said rockfalls were reported in another part of the island, where boulders crashed onto a packed beach sending tourists fleeing just last month.And part of a church wall collapsed on the mainland town of Pyrgos, in the southern Peloponnese area.Several of people were treated for minor injuries.Civil protection agency press spokesman Spyros Georgiou said a precautionary tsunami warning was issued.He added: “Were checking out the villages on the island, where there are several older buildings.“The lack of electricity is a problem, but technicians are trying to restore power.”Initial reports suggested the quake hit the Ionian sea, just off the western coast of Greece at just before pm local time.The Greek tourist island, popular with Brits, is understood to have been the epicentre.Greece lies in one of the worlds most earthquake-prone regions, with thousands of quakes recorded every year.But few cause injuries or signicant damage. In , a magnitude . quake on the outskirts of Athens killed  people.Zante has had severe earthquakes in the past, and as a result has a very strict building safety code.

story: NewsEsther McVey shuts door on journalist askingTory minister is in denial about Universal CreditThe Work and Pensions Secretary fled TV cameras this morning after an audit report blasted her for presiding over a "department in denial"ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video esther-mcvey-shuts-door-journalist-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTory Esther McVey has shut the door on a journalist askingshe is in denial about the hated benefit shake-up Universal Credit . The Work and Pensions Secretary fled TV cameras this morning after an audit report blasted her for presiding over a department in denial. More than .million people are on the six-in-one benefit, with more than  new Jobcentres hit by Christmas, as its blamed for food banks use and rent debts. In a damning report today, the Commons Public Accounts Committee said the Tory “fortress mentality” is failing claimants who are struggling to adapt. Meg Hillier, who chairs the PAC, said: “This report provides further damning evidence of a culture of indference at DWP - a department disturbingly adrt from the real-world problems of the people it is there to support.  “Its apparent determination to turn a deaf ear to the concerns of claimants, frontline organisations and Parliament is of real concern. Yet confronted by Sky News at her office today, Ms McVey denied she was in denial. Askedshe had any comment, the Tatton MP told Sky News - without stopping to talk - there is but Ive just got to get into work. Askedshe had presided over a culture of denial, she turned her back to the camera and replied: Absolutely not.  Were speaking with everybody at the moment, hence Ive started new partnership arrangements with the PAC and the Citizens Advice Bureau. Askedshe could repeat her comments - which were muffled due to her walking away at the time - she replied: I can but Im going inside. She then shut the door with a firm thud. A Downing Street spokeswoman today said Theresa May has full confidence in the Work and Pensions Secretary.

title: theresa proclaims strictly come dancing
story: NewsTheresa May proclaims Strictly Come Dancing will be fine after Brexit - but nothing  has cha-cha-changedWell thats one worry over with - but nothing has cha-cha-changed where, with talks still in deadlock and warnings a longer transition could cost billionsShareCommentsByAndrew GregoryPolitical EditorDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT NewsWell at least thats one worry over with from Dancing Queen Theresa May "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBrexit will pose no threat to Strictly Come Dancing, Theresa May declared today. That means theres one worry over with - but nothing has cha-cha-changed where. Talks with the EU are still in deadlock. The Prime Minister reportedly cancelled a meeting with ministers yesterday as plans werent ready, and there are warnings it will all cost Britain billions of pounds. Lib Dem leader Sir Vince Cable - who appeared on a Strictly Christmas special in  - had claimed immigration restrictions could deprive the show of talented foreign professional dancers.Sir Vince warned that a “cack-handed” immigration policy could prevent dancers from European Union states appearing on the show after Brexit .But he was mocked and the Prime Minister’s deputy official spokeswoman said: “I think Strictly will be fine.”  During a visit to Brussels on Thursday for talks with EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier, Sir Vince said: “As British society falls apart it could pose a risk to Strictly.” Sir Vince, a keen ballroom dancer, said: “If we have a cack-handed immigration policy like what we have for non-EU citizens, all kinds of perverse decisions could be made.”It came as Sadiq Khan today urged Brussels to begin preparations to delay Brexit.The Mayor of London said this would allow time for a second referendum on membership or a change of government to negotiate a “good deal”.The Labour mayor held talks with EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier in Brussels, saying he wanted to avert a “political and economic crisis”. Mr Khan’s visit was the latest by a politician to Brussels for talks with the EU as the two sides seek a workable Brexit Withdrawal Agreement. Britain is currently due to leave the EU next March. It means there is just five months left to complete a workable Withdrawal Agreement and have it ratied by national parliaments. And talks are still deadlocked over the thorny issue of the Northern Irish border. An EU summit fell through with no deal last week, with another summit with  leaders not scheduled until mid-December. To break the deadlock, Mrs May offered to either extend Britains transition period beyond December  - or accept a backstop plan with no end date that would keep EU customs rules across the UK.  Both plans enrage Brexiteers. More than  Tory MPs have demanded Mrs May drop key aspects of her plan. And today Sir William Cash, chairman of the Commons European Scrutiny, warned Mrs May extending the transition period could add billions of pounds to the poundbillion Brexit orce bill. After talks that lasted an hour in Brussels, Mr Khan said that Mr Barnier had been “willing to listen” to concerns about the negotiations. The mayor said: “I made the point that a bad Brexit deal, or even worse no deal whatsoever, it’s bad for London, it’s bad for our country but it is bad for the EU as well.

title: universal credit thousands face having
story: NewsUniversal Credit: Thousands face having no payments this Christmas - how to make sure youre not hitThe new benefit Universal Credit is rolling out to millions, and many could find themselves caught in a gap over Christmas. Heres how to avoid being caught outShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsYou could be in a five-week gap over Christmas - make sure youre not caught on the hop "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailUniversal Credit is rolling out to about , people a month, leaving a trail of rent debt and food banks in its wake. The six-in-one benefit is meant to make welfare easier and fairer, but its been bundled up with cuts that MPs warn cause unacceptable hardship.The Department for Work and Pensionshas been blasted for being in denial about the problems by Parliaments public spending watchdog. Meanwhile Christmas is fast approaching - and thousands of families face the risk of a financial gap over the holiday season. Thats because there is a standard five-week wait for your first payment when you start claiming Universal Credit.  Soyou start claiming at the end of November or midway through December, you are unlikely to get your first payment until the New Year. And to make matters worse, UC is being introduced in more than  Jobcentres in a final two-month rush before the end of the year. Redcar and Clevelands council leader Sue Jeffrey has claimed up to  families moving to Universal Credit face Christmas without money in her area alone. She told the Teesside Gazette: They will also not have access to the services who might be able to support them.  “This council, for example closes down over Christmas, and there are range of other organisations that will do the same.” But there is a way to avoid being high and dry, and not everyone is affected. So how do you knowyoure hit, and what action should you take  Heres a guide. What is Universal Credit   One system to replace six benefits: Child Tax Credit, Working Tax Credit, Jobseekers Allowance, Income Support, Employment Support Allowance and Housing Benefit. Tory minister Iain Duncan Smith launched it in  to make work pay, by ensuring your benefits taper away slowly as you earn more salary, rather than vanishing in one go. Am I being moved on to Universal Credit   If you are on one of the above benefits, then yes. But this article only deals with people who are being moved onto Universal Credit at the moment. Universal Credit is rolling out in two phases, and its important to know which one youre in. The first phase is already happening now - the second phase isnt. The first phase - people who ARE affected New claimants and existing claimants whose circumstances change are being put on the benefit right now. This process started in one area at a time, with each Jobcentre having its own launch date. The first Jobcentre launched UC in November . Now its in almost every Jobcentre, and the final  will launch it in November and December . That means that by this Christmas, anyone who makes a new claim anywhere in Britain will be put on Universal Credit. There were already .million people in this position by September . By May  it will be million, and by December  itll be million. The second phase - people who ARENT affected Up to million existing claimants will move onto UC later through a process called managed migration. They are not affected by the issue in this article. Unlike in the first phase, they will be able to access a poundbillion transition fund to ensure their benefit payments dont suddenly drop. They will also mostly not start moving over until summer .Only , people are being moved over in the first year from July  after Tory ministers slowed the process down. But beware - evenyoure an existing claimant, you could still be moved earlierthe DWP decides youve had a change of circumstances. So why the focus on Christmas   Campaigners fears are greatest when Universal Credit is new to an area. It means Jobcentre staff are dealing with their first cases under the new benefit, which its claimed could lead to teething problems and delays. So while anyone who claims from late November faces a wait over Christmas, its those in new Universal Credit areas who are being highlighted. There will be  Jobcentres launching Universal Credit in November and December. We have listed those areas in full at the bottom of this article. How do I ensure Im not left high and dry   Its important to know the DWP has a system to ensure your money is not cut off. Its called an advance payment. As soon as you make a claim for Universal Credit, you can apply for % of your first months payment. You apply through your online account or Jobcentre work coach, and it should arrive within five days. If you need help applying, call  . But theres a huge drawback - you have to pay the advance back out of your future benefits. The repayments can be spread over  months and there is no interest. Elsewhere, housing benefit will also keep being paid for the first two weeks of a Universal Credit claim, to help bridge the gap. title: easyjet leaves blind man stranded
story: NewsEasyJet leaves blind man stranded abroad after he refused to attach unsafe harness to guide dogDavid Ferguson was due to fly back from Portugal when a flight attendant demanded he attach a seat-belt extender to his beloved guide dog JamieShareCommentsByNeil Murphy:,  OCT NewsDavid Ferguson says his guide dog Jamie has changed his le six years ago"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA blind man says easyJet left him stranded after he was kicked off a plane when he refused to attach an unsafe harness to his guide dog. David Ferguson, from Bangor in Northern Ireland, was flying back to Belfast with his dog Jamie following a trip to southern Portugal. The pair were scheduled to take the .pm easyJet flight from Faro to Belfast City Airport on theirjourney home when they encountered problems. After boarding the aircraft, David says a flight attendant demanded he attach a seatbelt extender to his dog Jamie - something which David deemed unsafe as it was made for humans and not for dogs. The retired -year-old refused to use the extender because he feared for Jamies safety in the event of a crash.  David and Jamie have previously boarded flights to Gatwick and Spain without issue using a cushioned harness he provides for plane journeys. The safety harness is approved for use on airplanes by the Civil Aviation Authority, David says. David suffers from Usher syndrome, a disorder that causes loss of both hearing and vision, and says he struggled to understand the companys staff.The flight was held up for  minutes while he negotiated with crew - but was eventually booted off the plane. At one stage, a pilot for the airline intervened in the dispute but found nothing wrong with seat belt extender. I was humiliated in front of the people on that aircraft, he said. Ive been with my dog  hours a day since I got him six years ago and as blind people were told to always know where our dogs are at all times.  Theres no way I would put him in danger or allow anyone to put him in danger. The airline effectively left a blind person stranded in the airport with almost no way of getting home. David originally booked his holiday with Thomas Cook and says he was surprised when he discovered that he would be flying with easyJet. After being kicked off the plane, David was left with no alternative but to fork out €for a Ryanair flight back to Dublin. Once there, had to endure a two-hour bus trip to Belfast from the Irish capital. David arrived home at .am thanks to help from his good friend Kenny Tosh who drove him back from the airport. He says his quality of le has improved dramatically since he was given the eight-year-old Labrador back in . He has literally changed my le, David said.  Before I had Jamie I was afraid to leave the house on my own unless someone picked me up. At one stage I walked into a lamppost and I was nearly knocked over. David has demanded airline staff be better informed about the challenges faced by blind people when travelling on their aircraft. If this is how they treat blind people Id be amazed to see how they treat able-bodied persons, he said. An easyJet statement toread: Unfortunately Mr Ferguson and his guide dog were not permitted to travel from Faro to Belfast on September  as he failed to comply with on-board safety regulations surrounding the securing of his dog for take off and landing. “Our policy makes it clear that dogs must wear a standard identying jacket or harness which is provided by the owner, which must be attached to the owners seat belt via the use of an extension seat belt in order to provide an effective level of restraint. “The safety and wellbeing of passengers and crew is always easyJets highest priority.”

story: NewsMeghan Markle curtsies to Queen of Tonga as she and Harry bid farewell before ing to SydneyThe Duke and Duchess of Sussex visited the Royal Palace for an audience with King Tupou VI and his we Queen Nanasipau’uShareCommentsByRussell MyersAnn GripperExecutive EditorNatalie Evans:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video meghan-opts-bold-blue-dress-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailShes the actress who became a princess, but Meghan Markle still knows how to show respect to royalty. The Duchess of Sussex politely curtsied as she greeted the Queen of Tonga following a whistle-stop stay on the island. Before heading back to Sydney for the Invictus Games, Harry and Meghan were driven to the Royal Palace for an audience with King Tupou VI and his we Queen Nanasipau’u. The couple entered the wooden, whitewashed palace and spent around  minutes inside with the royals.  The Duke and Duchess signed a visitor’s book before they left and then posed outside with the king and queen for photographers. They also shook hands with the Tongan ruler and his we, Meghan, noticeably curtsying to the Queen. Meghan injected a splash of colour into Friday afternoons royal engagements with a bold blue dress. She had a quick outfit change, ditching her earlier striped frock for a pound shirt dress by American designer brand Veronica Beard.  The royal couple visited Tupou College, where they dedicated two forest reserves to the Queens Commonwealth Canopy. The QCC is a project which sees countries of the Commonwealth designate areas of indigenous forest to be preserved in perpetuity, with  of the  member countries already taking part.  Speaking at Tupou College, the duke said: Tonga is leading by example and understands deeply the impact of environmental changes because they directly affect these islands. Planting trees and conserving forests helps us in so many ways. It is a simple but effective way to restore and repair our environment, clean the air, protect habitat and enhance our health and wellbeing.  We are so very grateful to you for this contribution of the Toloa Forest Reserve and the Eua National Park Forest Reserve. During a ceremony which featured hymns, with Harry appearing to sing along to Guide Me O Thou Great Redeemer, the duke and duchess smiled at each other. Harry was then taken on a tour of the forest while the schools band and pupils continued to sing.  Earlier on Friday, Meghan wore a Martin Grant dress with a large bow covering her baby bump as she joined Prince Harry to meet the Tongan Prime Minister. The couple were met by more than  civil servants wearing red and black shirts and traditional outfits, as they entered the St George Government Buildings for a meeting with PM ʻAkilisi Pohiva and his cabinet. One child held a sign saying free hugs which Meghan spotted and smiled. The couple then took the lt to meet the Prime Minister, who was at last nights black tie banquet with the Tongan royal family and the Sussexes, with Harry asking Did you enjoy last night  The entertainment was very good. The remainder of the meeting was held in private.  Meghans pound, cotton dress is from the SS  Resort Collection. It is described as having a button-down silhouette, mandarin collar, circle skirt and belted accent at the waist. Meghan has previously worn a trench coat from the collection during this tour. The couple later had floral garlands placed round their necks as they arrived for a noisy celebration of Tongan youth and culture. Harry and Meghan joined Princess Angelika and Prince Ata, Kings Tupou VIs son and daughter, at the Faonelua Centre, showing products such as traditional mats and tapa cloth, carvings, bracelets made from whale bone and wood. Inside, they sat on two throne-like chairs in the centre of the room, while Princess Angelika delivered a short address and called the couple an inspiration to the youth of the Commonwealth for shining a light on youth empowerment.  She said: Your visit today draws attention to the fundamentals of todays youth, youth leadership, youth empowerment and addressing the social, economic and environmental challenges of our region. Your visits inspires and has been an inspiration for the youth of Tonga to be the best they can be. You are a beacon of hope to us all. Outside, the couple were given a Taovalawhich signies Tongan respect to the higher ranks. They met local Tongan traders and craftsmen as the Masani group of singers and dancers performed island music and songs. Harry appeared to do a little jig as the music started. The Sussexes will also visit the oldest secondary school in the Pacic where two forest reserves will be dedicated to the Queens Commonwealth Canopy Project.  They will then fly to Sydney from Fuaamotu airport in the afternoon. And they are straight back into engagements in Australia as they attend the Australian Geographic Society Awards at the Shangri-La Hotel in the evening. At last nights banquet with King Tupou VI and Queen Nanasipau’u Nuku’alofa, Harry said he felt ashe was visiting an extended family and delivered a message from the Queen. Her message was: Your Majesties, it gives me great pleasure that my grandson and his we are visiting The Kingdom of Tonga. Our two families have enjoyed a deep and warm friendship over many years, and I hope that our close relationship continues with the next generation. To this day, I remember with fondness Queen Salotes attendance at my own Coronation, while Prince Philip and I have cherished memories from our three wonderful visits to your country in ,  and . In the months and years ahead, I wish Your Majesties and the people of Tonga every good fortune and happiness.  The duke had high praise for Tongas talents in many dferent fields. He said: Tongan soldiers served with our allies during the First and Second World Wars and later independently to offer support in Iraq and Afghanistan. Tongan hospitality is world renowned your islands are stunningly beautul offering tourists rugged coastlines, humpback whales and coral reefs. Tongas sporting prowess is legendary you are formidable on the rugby pitch , and you were the first Pacic island nation to win a medal at the Olympics! Is there no end to your talents  Tongan artists such as Uili Lousi are winning international awards and your magnicent artefacts were a highlight at the recent Oceania exhibition in London, which my we enjoyed very much when she opened it. For a small population you have a very large presence on the world stage - a product of your talent and drive. We are both so looking forward to meeting many of you tomorrow- learning more about your culture and development as a strong and independent country.

title: michael sheen its superheroes who
story: NewsopinionMichael Sheen: It’s the superheroes who save us when the safety net failsCouncil budgets slashed, public services decimated, foodbanks, mental health issues, domestic violence, the effects of Universal CreditShareCommentsByMichael Sheen:,  OCT NewsopinionActor Michael Sheen meets with Sue, who he describes as a real-le superhero "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSue is on the frontline. shyEveryone knows Sue. At  years of age and not five feet tall, she’s the closest thing you’ll find to a real-le superhero. She works for a charity called TRAC out of a small shop in Trevethin, Gwent. Trevethin has it harder than most, but it’s not unlike far too many other communities across the country that would recognise what’s happening there. Council budgets slashed, public services decimated, foodbanks, mental health issues, domestic violence, the effects of Universal Credit. “I don’t want to swear”, says Sue, “but, you know, we’re saving lives here because others have given up on the people that get referred to us.”  With a small team of staff and committed volunteers, Sue makes sure the basics are there for people who need them – furniture, clothing, food, fuel, white goods. Some of them are reclaimed from landfill, others are donations from all over the area. Care agencies refer people who need help to TRAC, and within hours provisions are on their way. Sue delivers them herself, her head just visible above her van’s steering wheel. “We’re trying to prevent them from going to doorstep lenders and shycompanies like BrightHouse,” she says. “I’m paying out on the van now and it’s not going to last much longer.” With so many services in the area being cut back – mental health services, hostels, council support and welfare – the need for Sue’s help is only increasing.

title: salisbury cathedral part new axis
story: NewsopinionIs Salisbury Cathedral part of a new Axis of Evil That spire seems to have an awful lot to answer forShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  OCT Newsopinion"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIran did a deal. Iraq got bombed back to the Stone Age. North Korea was invited to tea. Into the void where the Axis of Evil once terried the world, a new existential threat to civilisation has been born. And it has a spire  metres tall. Unbeknown to the , tourists who visit it each year, it seems that Salisbury Cathedral is built on an inter-dimensional whirlpool which sucks evil down towards hell like sand in an hour-glass. The presence of these unwitting pilgrims, walking widdershins around the cloisters, merely speeds up the spiritual centruge.Hence the bemusement of Russian spies who, on an entirely-heterosexual visit under  names to the East End of London, found themselves dragged towards the bewitching building. They broke free of its unearthly tractor beam only when they dropped a bottle of perfume that Ruslan had bought as a gt for his mother, and was unfortunately past its sell-by date.Caught in the Salisbury swirl, the liquid mutated into a battlefield nerve agent with unforeseen deadly consequences when it was dropped on the doorstep of a building that happened to be home to a Russian defector. They didnt get to see the spire. Which is a shame, because theyd heard it was the tallest in Britain.  The vortex is felt across the world. It drew a team of  assassins from Riyadh to Istanbul, where CCTV was disabled when an unfortunate journalist tripped and fell over a discarded bone saw, several times, and then cut off his own face and thew it down a well. It also compelled his accidental murderers to flee before the Turkish authorities could persuade them to headbutt a bullet, develop a sexual attraction to mincers, or perhaps most suicidally of all, announce they were taking up careers as journalists.The evil eddy even forced an otherwise-gentle and liberal soul entirely in tune with st century social norms to scream UGLY BLACK B******! at a Windrush migrant.The more cynical corners of the internet have whispered that Ryanair flights are the twisted children of Salisburys malevolent maelstrom, producing miniaturised tides of despair and misery, but the companys official ouija board insists in the face of all the evidence that it is just a coincidence.  Now it appears Salisburys undertow to the underworld has drawn someone all the way into the cathedral itself, there to smash two holes in the specially-toughened glass box in which lies one of only  remaining original copies of the Magna Carta.At time of writing no-one has been charged in relation to the Get Carta incident, but there are three madcap theories of who could be responsible:. A grammarist insistent on adding the definite article to the documents customary description, becausethe is written on the bloody thing people cant not use it . The ruler of a nation in political crisis who wants to add a th clause stating Brexit means Brexit on the basisthey didnt know what it meant in the th century she cannot be blamed for making it up as she goes along in the st . Nicholas Cage on one of his many flights of fancy, trying to crack a hidden medieval code that links the Founding Fathers to Jesus secret lovechild, whose ultimate descendant turns out to be Indiana Jones dad.  Of course, thats all ridiculous, isnt it  As mad as finding someone in Old Sarum wants planning permission for an underground shark tank, or that Kim Jong Un has moved his embassy to Middle Wallop. Or genuinely thinking that because both Porton Down and a village called Palestine are in the vicinity, Salisbury must be on speed-dial to the Devil himself. There are no forces of evil. Salisbury is no more be a wormhole to the netherworld than it is a coral atoll in the South Pacic. Whoever tried to steal the Magna Carta was too dumb to realise it was alarmed, it would disentegrate within  minutes and would be harder to sell on than Philip Greens used undercrackers. Evil is a supernatural force which means some people are born beyond redemption - destined for corruption and amorality, and liablecaught to be crucied, electried, poisoned or shot because theyre something other than human. But evil is just an excuse.Humans are merely bad. They make bad decisions and do bad things, making bad excuses along the way. Vladimir Putin ordered the elaborately-dficult murder of Sergei Skripal because he thought the defector was evil, and evil deserves the effort. The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia ordered the elaborately-messy murder of Jamal Kashoggi for the same reason. And people like the Ryanair racist arent evil, either. story: NewsUK weather: Met Office issues snow and ice warnings for today and tomorrow as biting Arctic front moves inForecasters say its time to get the warm winter clothes out as Britain braces for a dramatic drop in temperaturesShareCommentsByNeil Murphy:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video bitterly-cold-winds-snow-ice-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailForecasters have issued snow and ice warnings this weekend as the country is gripped by freezing temperatures and bone-chilling Arctic winds. A yellow warning for snow and ice is in place for northern Scotland from pm on Friday, while another for ice takes effect in Northern Ireland from am on Saturday. Even in southern parts, where temperatures are forecast to be around C , the wind chill factor means it will feel several degrees cooler, forecasters said.  Forecasters warned of patchy ice and slush affecting some upland routes as well as rail and road disruption. Snow may dust the tops of hills in the Pennines in northern England, Snowdonia in north-west Wales, the North York Moors, and across the Scottish Highlands. Met Office meteorologist Aidan McGivern said: Snow building up over the higher routes, some icy patches for the north of Scotland as well as Northern Ireland to watch out for first thing Saturday. Gritters are on standby across the country, with a number of councils posting pictures of their fleets online. Motorists have been warned to take extra care on the roads and anticipate widespread frost as thermometers drop to - Celcius overnight in higher parts. Showers in Scotland could turn wintry, with snow possible, but mainly over high ground. There will be sunny spells at times too. A cold northerly breeze. Tonight : Wintry showers will continue over the high ground of northern Scotland tonight. Showers too for Northern Ireland and Wales and some coastal areas through to dawn. It will be largely clear and dry across the central belt. Frost will develop for many into the early hours. A cold northerly breeze. UK Outlook : Another cold day tomorrow, with showers for the east coast, northern Scotland, Wales and the south-west. These could be wintry, especially in Scotland. Scattered showers in the south-east by the evening. Sunday will be dry and sunny for many, but with the chance of showers on the east coast. Breezy.

story: NewsPearl Black inquest: CPS reveals driver whose runaway car killed The Voice stars daughter will NOT be chargedPearl died aged  months after a brick wall hit by the Range Rover collapsed on top of her as she walked to the park with her father and baby brotherShareCommentsByLucy Clarke-Billings:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPearl, aged  months, died after a brick wall hit by a Range Rover collapsed on top of her "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe driver of a runaway Range Rover which killed toddler Pearl Black will escape new criminal action - as the Crown Prosecution Service today ruled there is not enough evidence to charge him. Pearl, aged  months, died after the brick wall hit by the Range Rover collapsed on top of her as she walked to the park with her father and baby brother. Lorry driver Andrew Williams, , had been driving his Range Rover before leaving it on a steep driveway. But an inquest yesterday heard Mr Williams did not fully apply handbrake - and the automatic vehicle was not left in park.  Pearls devastated parents Paul and Gemma Black spoke out after coroner Andrew Barkley ruled Pearls death was accidental. Paul, , said that due to a legal loophole in the law Mr Williams could not be prosecuted. But a CPS spokesman has now stated that the decision not to charge Mr Williams came following a thorough review.  The spokesman said: The CPS carried out a thorough review of the evidence and concluded the case failed to meet the evidential test for prosecution. We have explained the reasons behind this decision to Pearls family and our thoughts remain with them. After the inquest Mr Black said he would walk to London to get a bill passed to change the law. He said: The vehicle was mechanically sound. It would not have movedit had been properly secured. Yet a simple loophole of law – that it started its descent on private rather than public land – has stopped us getting justice for our daughter. We shouldn’t be here at the coroner’s court today. We should have been given the justice we deserve at criminal court instead, the law as it stands has prevented any repercussions for what was not a fluke accident and could have been completely avoided had the handbrake been fully applied and the automatic transmission correctly placed in park. This is why we are now calling on the Government to change the law so that no other family has to suffer as we have.  The inquest, in Pontypridd, heard Pearl was with her singer father Paul and her eight-month-old brother Acer when the tragedy happened in August . Mr Black screamed: Shes gone. The wall has crushed her, after the Range Rover ploughed into it in Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales. Tests were carried out on the .-tonne Range Rover after it was recovered from the scene. Investigators found the handbrake of the x had been only been applied two notches - out of a possible six.  The gear lever was between park and reverse. Coroner Andrew Barkley gave a conclusion of accidental death. He said: “Mr Williams said he assumed the gear lever was in park. As far as the application of the brake is concerned, he did not count the number of clicks. Sadly, as we know, that was insufficient. It seems the issue here was very much driver operation.”

story: NewsMeghan Markle stuns in £, monochrome ball gown of bold birds at awardsThe Duchess of Sussex wore an Oscar de la Renta dress at the Australian Geographic Society Awards in Sydney on FridayShareCommentsByNeil MurphyRussell Myers:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video prince-harry-accepts-australian-geographic-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:true,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMeghan and Prince Harry arrived for the prestigious Australian Geographic Society Awards in Sydney on Friday evening. The annual gathering, which was hosted at the Grand Ballroom at the Shangri-La Hotel, recognises feats of excellence in adventure, science and conservation. The royals presented awards to young people who have made considerable contributions to the field and both gave an address to attendees. The Queen was given a special environmental award by the Society for the Queen’s Commonwealth Canopy, a worldwide campaign to boost forest conservation. Harry accepted the award on her behalf and paid a touching tribute to his father, the Prince of Wales.  He said: There was a time, when as human beings we thought the world belonged to us. Now we are beginning to realise that we actually belong to the world. We are responsible to it, and to each other. My father and others have been speaking about the environment for decades - not basing it on fallacy or new-age hypothesis, but rooted in science and facts, and the sobering awareness of our environmental vulnerability.And while those speeches would sometimes fall on deaf ears, he and others were unrelenting in their commitment to preserve the most valuable resource we have – our planet, he said. title: dundee appoint jimmy boyle as new assistant manager
story: Dundee have appointed Jimmy Boyle as assistant manager to Jim McIntyre.The -year-old steps up from his post as head of the Dark Blues youth academy to team up with the new boss who arrived to succeed Neil McCann last week.Jimmy has been in the dugout for the games against Livingston and Hearts and confirmation he’s to remain their permanently brings to an end the Billy Dodds saga that’s dragged on since the new manager arrived last week.Dodds, who was Jim’s number two at Ross County, was his first choice for the same post at Dens Park, but well documented matters relating to his departure after Dundee went into administration in  made him unacceptable to many Dark Blues fans.As well as him, it’s understood Dens legend Barry Smith and Aberdeen coach Barry Robson were also being considered.But Jim has opted for another man he knows well and who has extensive experience in coaching and management.The pair played together at Airdrie and during eight years with the Diamonds, Jimmy appeared in two Scottish Cup finals.After a career that included spells at a string of clubs including Queen’s Park, Livingston and Partick Thistle, he was Airdrie’s under- coach for several seasons before succeeding Kenny Black as manager in .He was sacked three years later, but was quickly appointed to the SFA’s coaching staff and in  was headhunted by Dundee to take charge of developing their emerging talent.Over the last two-and-half-years he’s transformed the fortunes of the club’s underage sides and last season saw him steer the Development squad to a second place finish in their league.Known for someone who prefers to stay out of the limelight, he has been persuaded to make the step back up to first team level and assist his old team-mate in keeping Dundee in the Premiership.A Dundee FC statement said: #Jimmy has been with the club since joining as head of youth development in . During that period he has overseen the academy while also managing the development side and helping out with the first team.
